page.title: 05ECOLOGY - FARMING
page.content: There are 5 farms in the study area, 3 are mixed and 2 solely arable. They vary in size from 400 to 600 acres. The flat land on the plateau has shallow limestone soils and is devoted to mainly cereals, with some sheep. The valley soils rear beef cattle. Barley and wheat have the greatest acreage, with some oats, turnips and potatoes. Wheat yields about 2 1/2 tons per acre with heavy use of fertilizers. Extremes of weather do occur with winter blizzards and summer drought being the main hazards, though not in 1985. The arable farms have massive investment in machinary, but are no longer the main source of {employment}in the village. Two farms have prestigious farmhouses which suggests prosperity.
